cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.current_location: about 35 mi (55 km) west of Cancun, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northwest across the southern Gulf of Mexico today, then turning north-northwest to north and aiming for the central-northwestern Gulf Coast (south-central Louisiana/western Louisiana coast) late Friday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-central to southwestern Louisiana coast (near Cameron/Vermilion Bay)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect yet – Hurricane and Storm-Surge Watches expected later today for portions of the northern Gulf Coast
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Texas–Louisiana border eastward to Mississippi coast
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds possible (49% chance of ≥34 kt, 21% chance of ≥50 kt, 10% chance of ≥64 kt) beginning Friday afternoon
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft surge possible near Sabine Pass and lower Neches River if Delta tracks just east of the port
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–6 inches of rain with locally higher amounts could cause flash and urban flooding Friday–Saturday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous seas and rip currents along the Upper Texas Coast; possible minor river flooding on the Neches and Sabine Rivers
